comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: The unnamed naval officer in the photograph, standing next to Major Frank H. Lawton (US Army), is Lt. Commander Charles E. Courtney (USN).  Courtney (USNA 1899) was the commander of the USS Jason at the time (likely November 11, 1914, see other recently LOC/Bain posted photos of USS Jason and Maj. F.H. Lawton).  Courtney would ultimately rise to the rank of Vice Admiral before retiring from the Navy.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I agree, this looks like the outside of the terminal building in Brooklyn  where the Christmas Ship presents were being packed.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: More Bain pictures of the Christmas Ship expedition: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/tags/jason/
